title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement contact details DESCRIPTION file. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Authors and Citation
text: de Vries P (2026). CopernicusDataspace: Search Download Handle Data Copernicus Data Space Ecosystem. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://github.com/pepijn-devries/CopernicusDataspace.
code: @Manual{,   title = {CopernicusDataspace: Search Download and Handle Data from the Copernicus Data Space Ecosystem},   author = {Pepijn {de Vries}},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://github.com/pepijn-devries/CopernicusDataspace}, }

what: Search Download and Handle Data from the Copernicus Data Space Ecosystem
title: Search Download and Handle Data from the Copernicus Data Space Ecosystem
text: Copernicus Data Space Ecosystem, open ecosystem provides free instant access wide range data services Copernicus Sentinel missions planet’s land, oceans atmosphere. package provides entry points several APIs allowing users access data directly R.

title: Search Download and Handle Data from the Copernicus Data Space Ecosystem
text: moment, package still experimental. can therefore installed GitHub:
code: remotes::install_github("pepijn-devries/CopernicusDataspace")

title: Search Download and Handle Data from the Copernicus Data Space Ecosystem
text: Copernicus Data Space Ecosystem offers access services several APIs. package offers access via following APIs: OData; STAC; SentinelHub. README shows essential methods downloading data. detailed information consult respective vignettes: vignette("OData"); vignette("STAC"); vignette("SentinelHub")

title: Search Download and Handle Data from the Copernicus Data Space Ecosystem
text: actually downloading files Copernicus Data Space Ecosystem, usually need form authentication. Examples use credentials stored environment variables. information effectively authenticate download requests, please see vignette("Authentication").

title: Search Download and Handle Data from the Copernicus Data Space Ecosystem
text: know STAC identifier (asset_id) asset name wish download, can simply use example shown . often speed request include collection id. don’t know details, first explore catalogue. Please see vignette("STAC") details working STAC catalogue.  produces tile Southern Ocean near Antarctica.
code: library(CopernicusDataspace) library(stars) ## For reading and plotting the downloaded file  ## Only run this if an S3 secret is specified: if (dse_has_s3_secret()) {      filename  <- dse_stac_download(     asset_id   = "Copernicus_DSM_COG_30_S69_00_W062_00_DEM",     asset      = "data",     collection = "cop-dem-glo-90-dged-cog",     tempdir())      tile_stac <- read_stars(filename)      plot(tile_stac, col = hcl.colors(100), axes = TRUE)    }

title: Search Download and Handle Data from the Copernicus Data Space Ecosystem
text: produces map Lake Upemba Congo. TODO
code: ## Only run this if client info is available: if (dse_has_client_info()) {   response <-     dse_odata_download_path(     product     = "2f497806-0101-5eea-83fa-c8f68bc56b0c",     node_path   = paste(       "DEM1_SAR_DTE_90_20101213T034716_20130408T035028_ADS_000000_5033.DEM",       "Copernicus_DSM_30_S09_00_E026_00", "DEM",       "Copernicus_DSM_30_S09_00_E026_00_DEM.dt1", sep = "/"),     destination = tempdir())      tile_odata <- read_stars(response$body)   plot(tile_odata, col = terrain.colors(100), axes = TRUE) }

title: Search Download and Handle Data from the Copernicus Data Space Ecosystem
text: TODO
code: ## Only run this if client info is available: if (dse_has_client_info()) {   bounds <- c(5.261, 52.680, 5.319, 52.715)    ## prepare input data   input <-     dse_sh_prepare_input(       bounds = bounds,       time_range = c("2025-06-01 UTC", "2025-07-01 UTC")     )    ## prepare ouput format   output <- dse_sh_prepare_output(bbox = bounds)    ## retrieve processing script   evalscript <- dse_sh_get_custom_script("/sentinel-2/l2a_optimized/")    fl <- tempfile(fileext = ".tiff")      ## send request and download result:   dse_sh_process(input, output, evalscript, fl)    enkhuizen <- read_stars(fl) |> suppressWarnings()   plot(enkhuizen, rgb = 1:3, main = "Enkhuizen") }

what: Client Information and Access Token for the Data Space Store API — dse_access_token
title: Client Information and Access Token for the Data Space Store API — dse_access_token
text: regulate server traffic, Data Space Ecosystem uses user accounts regulate ensure fair usage. functions get token information usage.

title: Client Information and Access Token for the Data Space Store API — dse_access_token
code: dse_access_token(   client_id = dse_client_id(),   client_secret = dse_client_secret(),   ... )  dse_client_id(...)  dse_client_id(...) <- value  dse_client_secret(...)  dse_client_secret(...) <- value  dse_has_client_info(...)

title: Client Information and Access Token for the Data Space Store API — dse_access_token
text: client_id ID client registered account. client_secret Secret provided client registered account. ... Ignored value Assignment value setting client_id client_secret environment variable. set, persist remainder R session.

title: Client Information and Access Token for the Data Space Store API — dse_access_token
text: case dse_client_id() dse_client_secret(), can get (set) client details environment variables. way, persist throughout R session. function dse_has_client_info() returns logical value, indicating whether client details (id secret) available environmental variable. Note function returns TRUE, guarantee details valid (just available). case dse_access_token() named list returned, containing access token (named "token") additional meta information.

title: Client Information and Access Token for the Data Space Store API — dse_access_token
text: can use Data Space Ecosystem services, need create account register client. let retrieve access token, can used authentication purposes API requests. also used manage usage rate limiting (see also dse_usage() dse_user_statistics()). Note Amazon Simple Storage Service (s3) separate authentication requirements. See dse_s3() details.

title: Client Information and Access Token for the Data Space Store API — dse_access_token
text: First step creating account. can create one visiting login page click "register". Fill form follow instructions.

title: Client Information and Access Token for the Data Space Store API — dse_access_token
text: order register client, visit Sentinel Dashboard go "User settings". option create OAuth client. Follow instructions, make sure safely copy client id secret. latter displayed . detailed instructions provided API documentation

title: Client Information and Access Token for the Data Space Store API — dse_access_token
text: share R code, probably want share account details. can avoid using client_id client_secret script setting environment variable. can manually calling dse_client_id()<- dse_client_secret()<- start session. can also define .Rprofile file Sys.setenv(CDSE_API_CLIENTID = "<id>") Sys.setenv(CDSE_API_CLIENTSECRET = "<secret>"). way, set time start new R session. environment variables used default dse_access_token(), specify client details arguments.

title: Client Information and Access Token for the Data Space Store API — dse_access_token
text: completing previous two steps, now set obtain access token dse_access_token(). Repeatedly requesting access token may invoke rate limiting measures. Therefore, package uses caching temporarily store access token R session. Calling dse_access_token() therefore contact server token unique combination client_id client_server. , cached result reused session catch: token provided server valid limited time (usually 30 minutes). , token expired, need wipe cache. can calling memoise::forget(dse_access_token) restarting R session.

title: Client Information and Access Token for the Data Space Store API — dse_access_token
text: https://documentation.dataspace.copernicus.eu/APIs/SentinelHub/Overview/Authentication.html

title: Client Information and Access Token for the Data Space Store API — dse_access_token
code: if (interactive() && dse_has_client_info()) {   token <- dse_access_token() }

title: Setup Amazon Simple Storage Service for the Data Space Ecosystem — dse_s3
text: region AWS Region used instantiating client ... Ignored s3_key, s3_secret s3 key secret registered Data Space Ecosystem account value Replacement value s3_key s3_secret.

title: Setup Amazon Simple Storage Service for the Data Space Ecosystem — dse_s3
text: dse_s3() returns client Data Space Ecosystem s3 service. details see paws::s3(). dse_s3_key() dse_s3_secret() return requested s3 details set environment variable (see details). dse_has_s3_secret() returns logical value indicating whether s3 details (key secret) set. determine whether details valid.

title: Setup Amazon Simple Storage Service for the Data Space Ecosystem — dse_s3
text: Working s3 Data Space Ecosystem requires create account, register s3 key described . Note SentinelHub requires different authentication method. See dse_access_token() details .

title: Setup Amazon Simple Storage Service for the Data Space Ecosystem — dse_s3
text: First step creating account. can create one visiting login page click "register". Fill form follow instructions.

title: Setup Amazon Simple Storage Service for the Data Space Ecosystem — dse_s3
text: Now account, visit s3-credentials page, log account details. clicking "add credential", can create new key secret. Store safe place, secret shown . can pass key secret s3_key s3_secret arguments functions requesting . can also store environment variables persist throughout R session passed arguments (see ).

what: S3 Key and Secret as Environment Variables
title: Setup Amazon Simple Storage Service for the Data Space Ecosystem — dse_s3
text: share R code, probably want share account details. can avoid using s3_key s3_secret script setting environment variable. can manually calling dse_s3_key()<- dse_s3_secret()<- start session. can also define .Rprofile file Sys.setenv(CDSE_API_S3ID = "<key>") Sys.setenv(CDSE_API_S3SECRET = "<secret>"). way, set time start new R session.

title: Setup Amazon Simple Storage Service for the Data Space Ecosystem — dse_s3
text: https://documentation.dataspace.copernicus.eu/APIs/S3.html

title: Setup Amazon Simple Storage Service for the Data Space Ecosystem — dse_s3
code: if (interactive() && dse_has_s3_secret()) {   my_s3 <- dse_s3()   my_s3$get_object(Bucket = "", Key = "") |> summary() }

what: Prepare Input and Output Fields for Sentinel Hub Request — dse_sh_prepare_input
title: Prepare Input and Output Fields for Sentinel Hub Request — dse_sh_prepare_input
text: dse_sh_process() requires named list input output settings. functions documented produce lists required process request.

title: Prepare Input and Output Fields for Sentinel Hub Request — dse_sh_prepare_input
code: dse_sh_prepare_input(   bounds,   time_range,   collection_name = "sentinel-2-l2a",   id = NA,   max_cloud_coverage = 100,   mosaicking_order = "default",   upsampling = "default",   downsampling = "default",   harmonize_values = FALSE,   ... )  dse_sh_prepare_output(   width = 512,   height = 512,   output_format = "tiff",   bbox,   ... )

title: Prepare Input and Output Fields for Sentinel Hub Request — dse_sh_prepare_input
text: bounds bounding box geometry (classes sf::bbox, sf::sf, sf::sfc) defining boundaries output image. time_range vector two date-time values, specifying time range satellite data include process. collection_name collection name. defaults "sentinel-2-l2a" ensure get Sentinel-2 L2A data. id identifier. documented API reference material. max_cloud_coverage Maximum cloud cover included process. Value 0 100 (default) percent. mosaicking_order Sets order overlapping tiles output result mosaicked. "default", "mostRecent", "leastRecent", "leastCC". See also API documentation. upsampling, downsampling Specify interpolation technique output resolution smaller larger respectively available source data. See also API documentation. harmonize_values logical value indicating whether units harmonised indicated API documentation. ... Ignored width, height Size output image pixels. ignored bbox specified. output_format File format output file. one "tiff" (default), "jpeg", "png", "json". bbox can optionally provide bounding box (.e., copy bounds) calculate width height fixed aspect ratio. Width 512 definition, height choosen matches bounding box

title: Prepare Input and Output Fields for Sentinel Hub Request — dse_sh_prepare_input
text: named list can used input output argument dse_sh_process().

title: Prepare Input and Output Fields for Sentinel Hub Request — dse_sh_prepare_input
text: https://apps.sentinel-hub.com/requests-builder/

title: Prepare Input and Output Fields for Sentinel Hub Request — dse_sh_prepare_input
code: dse_sh_prepare_input(   bounds = c(5.261, 52.680, 5.319, 52.715),   time_range = c("2025-06-01 UTC", "2025-07-01 UTC") ) #> $bounds #> $bounds$bbox #> [1]  5.261 52.680  5.319 52.715 #>  #>  #> $data #> $data[[1]] #> $data[[1]]$type #> [1] "sentinel-2-l2a" #>  #> $data[[1]]$dataFilter #> $data[[1]]$dataFilter$timeRange #> $data[[1]]$dataFilter$timeRange$from #> [1] "2025-06-01T00:00:00+0000" #>  #> $data[[1]]$dataFilter$timeRange$to #> [1] "2025-07-01T00:00:00+0000" #>  #>  #> $data[[1]]$dataFilter$maxCloudCoverage #> [1] 100 #>  #>  #> $data[[1]]$processing #> $data[[1]]$processing$harmonizeValues #> [1] FALSE #>  #>  #>  #>   library(sf) #> Linking to GEOS 3.12.1, GDAL 3.8.4, PROJ 9.4.0; sf_use_s2() is TRUE shape <- st_bbox(c(xmin = 5.261, ymin = 52.680,                    xmax = 5.319, ymax = 52.715), crs = 4326) |>            st_as_sfc() dse_sh_prepare_input(   bounds = shape,   time_range = c("2025-06-01 UTC", "2025-07-01 UTC") ) #> $bounds #> $bounds$geometry #> NULL #>  #>  #> $data #> $data[[1]] #> $data[[1]]$type #> [1] "sentinel-2-l2a" #>  #> $data[[1]]$dataFilter #> $data[[1]]$dataFilter$timeRange #> $data[[1]]$dataFilter$timeRange$from #> [1] "2025-06-01T00:00:00+0000" #>  #> $data[[1]]$dataFilter$timeRange$to #> [1] "2025-07-01T00:00:00+0000" #>  #>  #> $data[[1]]$dataFilter$maxCloudCoverage #> [1] 100 #>  #>  #> $data[[1]]$processing #> $data[[1]]$processing$harmonizeValues #> [1] FALSE #>  #>  #>  #>   dse_sh_prepare_output(bbox = shape) #> $width #> [1] 512 #>  #> $height #> [1] 509.6204 #>  #> $responses #> $responses[[1]] #> $responses[[1]]$identifier #> [1] "default" #>  #> $responses[[1]]$format #> $responses[[1]]$format$type #> [1] "image/tiff" #>  #>  #>  #>

what: Process Satellite Data and Download Result — dse_sh_process
title: Process Satellite Data and Download Result — dse_sh_process
text: Users can request raw satellite data, simple band combinations false colour composites, calculations simple remote sensing indices like NDVI, advanced processing calculation Leaf area index (LAI).

title: Process Satellite Data and Download Result — dse_sh_process
code: dse_sh_process(   input,   output,   evalscript,   destination,   ...,   token = dse_access_token() )

title: Process Satellite Data and Download Result — dse_sh_process
text: input named list specifying input satellite data processed evalscript image. correctly formatted list can created dse_sh_prepare_input(). output named list specifying present output image, create evalscript. correctly formatted list can created dse_sh_prepare_output(). evalscript character string containing piece JavaScript, run Sentinel Hub server. used translate satellite data pixel data georeferenced image. information setting script please consult API documentation. can also use dse_sh_get_custom_script() obtain ready--go scripts SentinelHub repository. destination file name store downloaded image. ... Ignored token authentication, many Dataspace Ecosystem uses access token. Either provide access token, obtain one automatically dse_access_token() (default). Without valid token likely get "access denied" error.

title: Process Satellite Data and Download Result — dse_sh_process
text: httr2_response class object containing location downloaded file destination.

title: Process Satellite Data and Download Result — dse_sh_process
text: https://docs.sentinel-hub.com/api/latest/api/process/ https://apps.sentinel-hub.com/requests-builder/ https://custom-scripts.sentinel-hub.com/ https://github.com/sentinel-hub/custom-scripts https://docs.sentinel-hub.com/api/latest/evalscript/

title: Process Satellite Data and Download Result — dse_sh_process
code: if (interactive() && dse_has_client_info()) {    bounds <- c(5.261, 52.680, 5.319, 52.715)      ## prepare input data   input <-     dse_sh_prepare_input(       bounds = bounds,       time_range = c("2025-06-01 UTC", "2025-07-01 UTC")     )    ## prepare ouput format   output <- dse_sh_prepare_output(bbox = bounds)      ## retrieve processing script   evalscript <- dse_sh_get_custom_script("/sentinel-2/l2a_optimized/")      fl <- tempfile(fileext = ".tiff")   ## send request and download result:   dse_sh_process(input, output, evalscript, fl)    if (requireNamespace("stars")) {     library(stars)     enkhuizen <- read_stars(fl) |> suppressWarnings()     plot(enkhuizen, rgb = 1:3, axes = TRUE, main = "Enkhuizen")   } }

what: Guess the Collection id from an Asset id — dse_stac_guess_collection
title: Guess the Collection id from an Asset id — dse_stac_guess_collection
text: STAC catalogue contains large number records, request may receive timeout error. prevent best narrow requests specific collections. function helper function tries guess collection id asset id. Note method highly reliable, always best manually provide collection id request.

title: Guess the Collection id from an Asset id — dse_stac_guess_collection
code: dse_stac_guess_collection(asset_id)

title: Guess the Collection id from an Asset id — dse_stac_guess_collection
text: asset_id asset identifier name, used guess parent collection id.

title: Guess the Collection id from an Asset id — dse_stac_guess_collection
text: character string guessed collection id. NA case make guess.

title: Guess the Collection id from an Asset id — dse_stac_guess_collection
code: dse_stac_guess_collection(   "S2A_MSIL1C_20260109T132741_N0511_R024_T39XVL_20260109T142148") #> [1] "sentinel-2-l1c"

what: Get Queryables for a STAC Collection — dse_stac_queryables
title: Get Queryables for a STAC Collection — dse_stac_queryables
text: searching collection dse_stac_search_request(), can helpful know elements can used filter search results (using dplyr::filter()). Calling dse_stac_queryables() tells aspects available querying expected formats.

title: Get Queryables for a STAC Collection — dse_stac_queryables
code: dse_stac_queryables(collection, ...)

title: Get Queryables for a STAC Collection — dse_stac_queryables
text: collection Name collection get queryables. ... Ignored

title: Get Queryables for a STAC Collection — dse_stac_queryables
text: Returns named list information elements can used query collection

title: Get Queryables for a STAC Collection — dse_stac_queryables
code: if (interactive()) {   dse_stac_queryables("sentinel-1-grd") }

what: Create a Request for a STAC Search in the Data Space Ecosystem — dse_stac_search_request
title: Create a Request for a STAC Search in the Data Space Ecosystem — dse_stac_search_request
text: order perform search using STAC API, first need create request using dse_stac_search_request(). creates httr2::request() tidy verbs ?tidy_verbs can applied (e.g., dplyr::select(), dplyr::filter() dplyr::arrange(). Results retrieved calling dplyr::collect() request.

title: Create a Request for a STAC Search in the Data Space Ecosystem — dse_stac_search_request
code: dse_stac_search_request(collections, ids, ...)

title: Create a Request for a STAC Search in the Data Space Ecosystem — dse_stac_search_request
text: collections Restrict search collections listed . ids Restrict search ids listed . ... Arguments appended search filter request body.

title: Create a Request for a STAC Search in the Data Space Ecosystem — dse_stac_search_request
text: Returns data.frame search results.

title: Create a Request for a STAC Search in the Data Space Ecosystem — dse_stac_search_request
text: prefer graphical user interface, can alternatively use STAC web browser.

title: Create a Request for a STAC Search in the Data Space Ecosystem — dse_stac_search_request
code: if (interactive()) {   library(dplyr)   library(sf)      bbox <-     sf::st_bbox(       c(xmin = 5.261, ymin = 52.680, xmax = 5.319, ymax = 52.715),       crs = 4326)    dse_stac_search_request("sentinel-2-l1c") |>     filter(`eo:cloud_cover` < 10) |>     collect()    dse_stac_search_request("sentinel-1-grd") |>     filter(`sat:orbit_state` == "ascending") |>     arrange("id") |>     st_intersects(bbox) |>     collect() }

title: Get Dataspace Account Information — dse_usage
text: order guarantee good performance users, Sentinel Hub applies rate limiting. policy enforces monthly quotas usage. check quota current usage, can call dse_usage() dse_user_statistics().

title: Get Dataspace Account Information — dse_usage
code: dse_usage(..., token = dse_access_token())  dse_user_statistics(   range = "DAYS-31",   resolution = "DAILY",   token = dse_access_token() )

title: Get Dataspace Account Information — dse_usage
text: ... Ignored token authentication, many Dataspace Ecosystem uses access token. Either provide access token, obtain one automatically dse_access_token() (default). Without valid token likely get "access denied" error. range Specify time range obtain user statistics. API expects string starting capitalised time unit ("DAYS", "HOURS"), followed dash ("-") integer value specifying length period. Default "DAYS-31". resolution Specifying temporal resolution user statistics. one "DAILY" (default), "MONTHLY", "HOURLY".

title: Get Dataspace Account Information — dse_usage
text: data.frame requested information user associated provided token.

title: Get Dataspace Account Information — dse_usage
code: if (interactive() && dse_has_client_info()) {   dse_usage()   dse_user_statistics() }

what: Filter OData and STAC Requests Using Geometries — st_intersects
title: Filter OData and STAC Requests Using Geometries — st_intersects
text: Filters OData STAC rows intersect spatial feature y.

title: Filter OData and STAC Requests Using Geometries — st_intersects
code: st_intersects.odata_request(x, y, sparse = FALSE, ...)  st_intersects.stac_request(x, y, sparse = FALSE, ...)

title: Filter OData and STAC Requests Using Geometries — st_intersects
text: x Either odata_request class object, generated dse_odata_products_request()/dse_odata_bursts_request(); stac_request generated dse_stac_search_request(). y spatial geometry either class sf (see sf::st_as_sf()) sfc (see sf::st_as_sfc()). always transformed WGS 84 projection (EPSG:4326). sparse Argument inherited generic definition. Ignored context ... Ignored

title: Filter OData and STAC Requests Using Geometries — st_intersects
text: Returns object class x, geometry filter added .

title: Filter OData and STAC Requests Using Geometries — st_intersects
code: if (interactive()) {   bbox <-     sf::st_bbox(       c(xmin = 5.261, ymin = 52.680, xmax = 5.319, ymax = 52.715),       crs = 4326) |>       sf::st_as_sfc()    dse_odata_products_request() |>     dplyr::filter(       `ContentDate/Start` > "2025-01-01") |>     sf::st_intersects(bbox) |>     dplyr::collect()    dse_stac_search_request() |>     st_intersects(bbox) |>     dplyr::collect() }

what: Perform a Request to Get a Response — req_perform
title: Perform a Request to Get a Response — req_perform
text: wrapper around httr2::req_perform(), can also handle odata_request class objects. Check httr2::req_perform() details.

title: Perform a Request to Get a Response — req_perform
code: req_perform(   req,   path = NULL,   verbosity = NULL,   mock = getOption("httr2_mock", NULL),   error_call = rlang::current_env() )

title: Perform a Request to Get a Response — req_perform
text: req Either httr2::request() class object odata_request class object. latter can created dse_odata_products_request() dse_odata_bursts_request(). path Optionally, path save body response. useful large responses since avoids storing response memory. verbosity much information print? wrapper around req_verbose() uses integer control verbosity: 0: output 1: show headers 2: show headers bodies 3: show headers, bodies, curl status messages. Use with_verbosity() control verbosity requests affect directly. mock mocking function. supplied, function called request. return either NULL (want handle request) response (). See httr2::with_mock()/ local_mock() details. error_call execution environment currently running function, e.g. caller_env(). function mentioned error messages source error. See call argument abort() information.

title: Perform a Request to Get a Response — req_perform
text: Returns httr2::response class object

what: Tidy Verbs for OData API and STAC Requests — tidy_verbs
title: Tidy Verbs for OData API and STAC Requests — tidy_verbs
text: Implementation tidy generics features supported either OData STAC API requests. can called objects either class: odata_request stac_request. first produced dse_odata_products_request() dse_odata_bursts_request(); latter dse_stac_search_request().

title: Tidy Verbs for OData API and STAC Requests — tidy_verbs
code: filter.odata_request(.data, ..., .by = NULL, .preserve = FALSE)  filter.stac_request(.data, ..., .by = NULL, .preserve = FALSE)  compute.odata_request(x, skip = 0L, ...)  collect.odata_request(x, skip = 0L, ...)  collect.stac_request(x, ...)  arrange.odata_request(.data, ..., .by_group = FALSE)  arrange.stac_request(.data, ..., .by_group = FALSE)  slice_head.odata_request(.data, ..., n, prop, by = NULL)  slice_head.stac_request(.data, ..., n, prop, by = NULL)  select.odata_request(.data, ...)  select.stac_request(.data, ...)

title: Tidy Verbs for OData API and STAC Requests — tidy_verbs
text: .data, x object either class odata_request stac_request. produced dse_odata_products_request(), dse_odata_bursts_request() dse_stac_search_request() ... Data masking expressions, arguments passed embedded functions skip Number rows skip collecting results. API never returns 20 rows. Specify number rows skip order get results beyond first 20 rows. n Maximum number rows return. , ., .by_group, .preserve, prop Arguments inherited generic dplyr functions. Ignored current context either grouping allowed OData API request otherwise supported.

title: Tidy Verbs for OData API and STAC Requests — tidy_verbs
text: functions (except collect()) return modified stac_request/odata_request object, containing lazy tidy operations. collect() return data.frame() yielding result request.

title: Tidy Verbs for OData API and STAC Requests — tidy_verbs
text: odata_request stac_request class objects use lazy evaluation. means functions evaluated calling dplyr::collect() request. Note call functions exported package directly. Instead, call generics declared dplyr package. illustrated examples.

title: Tidy Verbs for OData API and STAC Requests — tidy_verbs
text: order manage server traffic, OData API never returns 20 rows. want obtain results beyond first 20 rows, need specify skip argument. STAC API limits results first 10 rows. can expand limit dplyr::slice_head(). STAC number rows capped 10,000 records.

title: Tidy Verbs for OData API and STAC Requests — tidy_verbs
text: Due limitations posed OData API, tidyverse verbs deviate tidy standards. notably: dplyr::select(): change order columns. affact columns selected. Also, tidy selection helpers like dplyr::any_of() dplyr::all_of() supported dplyr::arrange(): OData allows sort 32 columns. Adding columns produce warning. Grouping supported tidy methods documented page supported odata_request stac_request objects. want apply full spectrum tidyverse methods, call dplyr::collect() stac_request/odata_request object first. return normal data.frame, can manipulated .

title: Tidy Verbs for OData API and STAC Requests — tidy_verbs
code: library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union if (interactive()) {   dse_odata_products_request() |>     filter(contains(Name, "WRR")) |>     select("Id", "Name") |>     arrange(Id, desc(Name)) |>     slice_head(n = 5) |>     collect()    dse_stac_search_request("sentinel-1-grd") |>     filter(`sat:orbit_state` == "ascending") |>     arrange("id") |>     collect() }

title: CopernicusDataspace V0.0.0.9000
text: STAC OData SentinelHub
